message.content:
There are twelve verb tenses in English which are used to describe actions or events, and their timing and duration. These include:
1. Simple Present (e.g., "I walk to school every day.")
2. Present Continuous (e.g., "She is playing tennis right now.")
3. Simple Past (e.g., "They ate pizza for dinner.")
4. Past Continuous (e.g., "The movie was boring.")
5. Present Perfect (e.g., "I have lived here for five years.")
6. Present Perfect Continuous (e.g., "She has been studying for hours.")
7. Simple Future (e.g., "We will go to the beach next weekend.")
8. Future Continuous (e.g., "The train will be arriving at 3:00pm.")
9. Present Perfect Progressive (e.g., "I have been studying for my exam.")
10. Past Perfect (e.g., "He had completed his work before he left the office.")
11. Past Perfect Continuous (e.g., "They had been playing chess for four hours when their parents arrived.")
12. Simple Future Progressive (e.g., "By next year, they will be living in New York.")
